macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Decline on Friday Amid Fed Nominee Uncertainty
items.summary: Wall Street indices closed lower on January 30, with the S&P 500 down 0.43% to 6,939.03, Dow Jones falling 0.36%-0.42% to 48,892.47, and Nasdaq dropping 0.94% to 23,461.82. Investors reacted uneasily to President Trump's new Federal Reserve nominee amid hotter-than-expected wholesale inflation data.

items.title: Verizon and Chevron Boosted Markets with Strong Earnings
items.summary: Verizon surged 6.6% on stronger-than-expected results, while Chevron rose 0.5% after a profit beat. Despite Friday's pullback, major indices posted January gains: S&P 500 up 1.8%, Dow 2.1%, Nasdaq 1.9%.

items.title: Tesla and Apple Mixed After Earnings Beats
items.summary: Tesla rose 4.3% rebounding from prior drop despite better profits, while Apple fell 0.3%-1.36% post-earnings. American Express tumbled 3.1% on earnings miss.

items.title: FTSE 100 Gains as European Markets Rise
items.summary: UK's FTSE 100 rose 0.51% to 10,223.54 and FTSE 250 up 0.11% on Friday. European indexes generally advanced following mixed Asia performance.

items.title: Hotter US Wholesale Inflation Pressures Fed Rate Cuts
items.summary: US wholesale inflation came in hotter than expected, potentially pressuring the Fed to hold rates steady. 10-year Treasury yield held at 4.24% after overnight spike.

items.title: Standout Stock Movers: RHI Surges 27.76%, PFSI Drops 33.25%
items.summary: Robert Half International (RHI) jumped 27.76% to 34.61, Deckers Outdoor (DECK) up 19.46%, while PennyMac Financial (PFSI) plunged 33.25% and Unity Software down 24.22%.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Everlight Launches Public Presale Amid Bitcoin Market Volatility
items.summary: Bitcoin Everlight has initiated its public presale for a lightweight transaction network that operates alongside the Bitcoin blockchain, focusing on transaction routing without altering Bitcoin's consensus. The project features a fixed supply of 21 billion BTCL tokens as market volatility persists due to macro liquidity shifts and institutional activity.

items.title: Crypto Market Sees High Bitcoin Trading Volumes Despite Broader Retail Sell-Off
items.summary: Recent crypto market analysis highlights Bitcoin trading volumes reaching 100 billion overall and 45 billion yesterday, bucking trends where retail investors sold assets to buy gold and silver amid a major market crash. Stablecoin market also in focus with positive volume developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Models Advancing Toward Recursive Self-Improvement Within 1-2 Years
items.summary: Frontier AI labs are approaching a critical milestone where current-generation AI systems could autonomously build the next generation, with leaders like Dario Amodei suggesting AI may handle most or all software engineering tasks within 6-12 months.

items.title: Reasoning-Focused AI Models Show Major Breakthrough in Complex Problem-Solving
items.summary: New generation models like DeepSeek R1 using reinforcement learning can now solve long, complex problems through step-by-step reasoning, with the latest models excelling at math and spatial tests where earlier LLMs failed.

items.title: AI Company Valuations Could Reach $30 Trillion in Medium Term
items.summary: Frontier AI labs could experience 10x valuation growth, with industry leaders projecting AI companies could be valued at approximately $30 trillion as the technology becomes increasingly transformative.

items.title: ASML Stock Upgraded with 70% Upside Potential on AI Chip Demand
items.summary: Morgan Stanley upgraded ASML Holding's outlook, projecting 70% stock price upside as the company's photolithography machines remain critical for advanced AI chip production amid stronger-than-expected AI spending forecasts for 2027.

items.title: New Data-Efficient Machine Learning Technique Reduces Electromagnetic Modeling Errors by 50%
items.summary: Researchers developed dissipative relaxation transfer learning (DIRTL), a physics-informed machine learning framework that achieves up to two-fold error reduction in electromagnetic simulations while requiring significantly less training data.

items.title: UN Emphasizes Education and Global Cooperation as Critical for AI Workforce Transition
items.summary: UN experts highlight that AI literacy education, new human-machine collaborative roles, and international cooperation are essential to manage job displacement risks and ensure equitable access to AI technology across countries.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Front Mission 3 Remake Launches on Multiple Platforms
items.summary: The remake of the iconic Front Mission 3 has launched on PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X|S as of January 30, 2026, expanding beyond its initial Nintendo Switch exclusivity.

items.title: Nintendo to Release Two Canceled 1996 Virtual Boy Games on Switch
items.summary: Nintendo announced that previously unreleased titles Zero Racers (F-Zero franchise) and D-Hopper will join Nintendo Switch Online's Virtual Boy catalog later in 2026, alongside other Virtual Boy games starting February 17.

items.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Sells Over 11 Million Units
items.summary: Capcom's Monster Hunter Wilds has achieved sales of over 11 million units, marking a significant industry milestone.

items.title: French Unions Call for Massive International Strike in Gaming Industry
items.summary: French unions have called for a massive international strike in January 2026 amid ongoing industry labor disputes.

items.title: Nintendo Restricts Access or Features in Latest Update
items.summary: Nintendo has implemented new restrictions, details emerging on January 31, 2026, potentially affecting players or services.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
